reviews.text:
We moved to Clarence about a year ago. This park is one of the best, they have a pond you can fish in. They have a number of community events that are very well thought out and executed. 
  They sponsor a fishing derby in the spring and have lavish prizes for the kids, the hosts are super friendly and work well with the patrons during the events 
 The have historical house on the campus and many trails and areas to picnic at a full playground for the children and it is  very well manicured 
You will have to check the events calendar as there are way to many to list, but if your in the area i would highly recommend you stop and visit the park
Very nice park. Well kept. Gotta love ducks
A huge enjoyable park for everyone.
I love this park so much it's my favorite  it has a lot of fun things to do there I really love the fountain if you have any questions I'd be happy😄😃😁 to answer them
Lovely green space. Good for all kinds of outdoor recreation in the middle of the 'burbs.
Nice place for a short hike
Nice place, quiet. Don't allow dogs though
I sometimes eat Lunch in the parking lot as it is shady and quiet. On that basis I feel four stars is appropriate.
It's a great place to walk around and check out the views
Beautiful
Good place to have good vibes and walk around. Usually not too many people there though it can get busy on the nicer days. There's some secret spots you can get to (:
Great place to go to decompress, and just walk with nature!
It's a great place to cross country ski!

This is a pretty neat public space, not far from Transit Road.  There are several miles of trails winding through woods, fields, marshes, swamps and more.  It was a very nice hike.  We were disappointed that we didn't see much wildlife, but I would bet there is a lot more during migration season
Nice out of the way place to take a walk.

Excellent place to relax. The atmosphere is nostalgic and comforting. The food and the service outstanding what a nice little Jewel of a place. If one needs to relax and clear the mind this is the place for you. Top marks will return again

Had a lovely tea with my Meetup group. We had a room to ourselves (a little chilly, but they had a space heater) and had ample food for our group of 12. Plenty of tea choices and the food was very tasty. Definitely would go again.
Meal was very good but I would have enjoyed the soup more if there was a bit less salt.  But, then again,  I don't use a lot of salt.  Certainly did not feel  rushed and had a wonderful server.

Our family loves Asa Ransom and chooses to celebrate important birthdays and special occasions there.  The rooms are beautiful and the food is fantastic.  We book reservations with them almost every year now, since my Mom is up in her 90's.  We like the more quiet atmosphere for her.  I will admit though, I had a rather disturbing situation happen to me when I called to make sure our reservations were correct for an upcoming dinner.  I was snapped at over the phone by a man who was handling the reservations.  He seemed busy and had another call after me and was getting impatient with having to look up information for me. This has made me a little uneasy with making future reservations with them.

Fine dining at it's best.   I had the mahi mahi and it was out of this world.   The food and service was exceptional, and the rustic feeling of the Ransom house made it feel like I was at a fancy dinner party back in the 1800s.
We have ordered from here a lot, eat in and take out. Yet today when we ordered a SMALL four cheese and steak were charged $10.00 more than the web site!!!  I will never buy food from them again.

Delicious pizza (and other favorites) fast, friendly service. I guess my only issue would be the difficulty to park. When the business is busy (quite often) the lot is full and lacking maneuverability room. However, that wouldn't stop me from visiting again ☺
Very good. Chicken wings nice & plump. Mozzarella sticks good too.
Very good fish fry drinks are amazing.  Portions are huge.  I will be going again.
Great customer service and the spinach calzone was delicious and huge!

Excellent place to relax. The atmosphere is nostalgic and comforting. The food and the service outstanding what a nice little Jewel of a place. If one needs to relax and clear the mind this is the place for you. Top marks will return again

Had a lovely tea with my Meetup group. We had a room to ourselves (a little chilly, but they had a space heater) and had ample food for our group of 12. Plenty of tea choices and the food was very tasty. Definitely would go again.
Meal was very good but I would have enjoyed the soup more if there was a bit less salt.  But, then again,  I don't use a lot of salt.  Certainly did not feel  rushed and had a wonderful server.

Our family loves Asa Ransom and chooses to celebrate important birthdays and special occasions there.  The rooms are beautiful and the food is fantastic.  We book reservations with them almost every year now, since my Mom is up in her 90's.  We like the more quiet atmosphere for her.  I will admit though, I had a rather disturbing situation happen to me when I called to make sure our reservations were correct for an upcoming dinner.  I was snapped at over the phone by a man who was handling the reservations.  He seemed busy and had another call after me and was getting impatient with having to look up information for me. This has made me a little uneasy with making future reservations with them.

Fine dining at it's best.   I had the mahi mahi and it was out of this world.   The food and service was exceptional, and the rustic feeling of the Ransom house made it feel like I was at a fancy dinner party back in the 1800s.
Great souvlaki - great prices and friendly service

Went with my sister-in-law and her friend you wanted a fish fry it was excellent. I had the lemon crusted haddock it was exceptional. White peach sangria was delicious as was there electric lemonade the waitress was very accommodating and was excellent. We will return here again for another meal nice menu
I am very fond of the gatehouse. The servers are very kind and  efficient . I haven't had a bad meal and good  alcohol drinks too. Definitely with each visit to New York I shall go to the Gatehouse

Wow the desserts! We had chocolate mousse with "pepper" ice cream. Wow. All I can say - wow. This chef is an artist. Wife had chicken Rockefeller. She loved it. I had 1/2 rack of ribs. Delicious! One flaw - I asked for some extra BBQ sauce on the side for my ribs, and the little plastic container and sauce was refrigerator cold when it arrived at my table. Otherwise a flawless dinner, and simply amazing dessert. I felt like I was a guest foodie judge at some cooking show - the dessert was that good. Server Nicole was knowledgeable, responsive and helpful explaining the menu. Most entree's under $20. Go there. You'll like it.

This place may not seem glamorous but the food is consistently good and is not overly  priced. We all enjoyed Reuben, crab salad, lamb chops, chicken sandwich and stuffed peppers.  No complaints. Wine prices are within reason.  Only negative is no craft beer on tap.

The food was excellent, the atmosphere was very nice and the service what's 5 *! Looking forward to going back in the near future. It appears on Monday and Tuesday's they have a great deal where you can get two meals and a bottle of wine for $36, I know my date and I are looking forward to going back and trying that on a Monday or Tuesday.
As part of a large group (10) I was duly impressed with Orazio's. Food was excellent; the staff courteous, prompt and efficient. We were able to have  quiet conversation and enjoy a special dinner.

We were fortunate to get reservations for Christmas Eve as most restaurants were closed for the evening. We were astounded by the huge crowd, but were well treated by the staff as they not only coped with so many people but a chef who was taken by ambulance a short time before our arrival. Our waitress was not only gracious she was energetic, always smiling and made us completely comfortable. All of us enjoyed our dinners. My husband and I actually enjoyed ours so much we had the same dinner at our annual New Years Eve dinner with friends. This us definitely one of our favorite restaurants.
It was fantastic!  He has brought Orazio's back.  Went there tonight and had my birthday dinner.  What a great.  Great food and service.  They care again

Great, unique Italian plates with a lot of attention to detail.  However, Google rates this as $$ for cost, but I think it's a bit more costly than that.  Not outrageously expensive, but above average.

Menu has changed. Hefty prices for average tasting Italian food. Huge portions, but $5 additional for sharing. No more whipped cheesecake... Not going to be a first choice Italian place for me anymore.

This place was great! It was really busy and packed when we went but guy at the counter was nice and took my order actually. He actually brought my twist and freeze dessert out to me as well! I loved the outside seating it was a great night and it meant that I got to bring my dog too. Plenty of parking here which is really convenient. It's right next to a big field too so you could take a nice walk after eating if you wanted which I really liked.
I love their frozen custard.. I have moved further away now but still try to visit once a year.  The food is good.. Nothing  special,  good variety to choose from. .i there for the custard...
Excellent service and food. We love this place.

I love the burgers here!  Had a juicy and tasty one today.  I gave 4 out of 5 stars because they got two things wrong on my order.  They forgot to give me the drink that comes with the combo meal and the order of Mac and cheese for my son.  They corrected it as soon as I mentioned it though.

Very nice place. Good food & ice cream. Nice play ground. Great place for kids. Only has 1 stall for woman & 1 stall for man. The service is fast, just know what you want. They call out your name when the order is ready.
Good pizza! I like the fact that they sell pizza by the slice. It works out for my two year old, we get her a couple of slices to go with our order.
Fantastic wings and pizza that is cooked to your liking. Try the garlic parmesan wings extra crispy. 🍗

We aren't from Clarence, gave it a try based off reviews.  We had a cheese pizza, a large chef salad, a Sinatra pizza and medium chicken wings.
We didn't care for the crust/pizza dough on either pizza, didn't think the sinatra tasted as great as its description made it sound it would.  The salad left quite a bit to be desired, but was fine.  The wings - we thought were good.  The bill was $65.  That we thought was high.
The owner came in while our family was there.  It made us uncomfortable a bit; he looking around...watching us.  
We did think the service was fast and friendly.
If I could give 2.5 stars I would.  We enjoyed the wings and the service, we likely will not go back.
"Sinatra" is the absolute Best Pizza~ We order it 1/2 Pepperoni and 1/2 mushrooms..  Our teenagers love it~
Pizza is average wings just okay workers and dinning area are nice.

My wife and I ate here for dinner. The only reason for the 4 star rating was that our waitress was not really in any hurry to take care of us. Out side of that the wings were extremely good. We got a meal that came with a pitcher of iced tea, a huge and I mean huge basket of fries, and 20 wings. Very reasonably priced and the wings are so worth it. We will be coming back the next time we are in Buffalo for sure

Pick up a bottle of Duffs sauce for the house and as a gift to send to your friends far away, it's great, especially on the BBQ grille.  I usually only order the fried shrimp basket, but there's no denying that the wings are great and hot. There's a lot more to the menu than just chicken wings just so you know. You'll leave completely stuffed and happy! Take out orders are almost always ready within 10 to 15 minutes.

This place was great. We ordered the special with  20 wings, a large fries, and a large pitcher of soda for $35.00. So much food. We couldn't eat all of it! We got the medium sauce....just spicy enough for us. A definite place we will come back to if we are in the Buffalo NY area

It feels very much like a chain. We walked in while a grade school sports team was there with their parents which affected the atmosphere. Really tasty wings. The double char—something or other, ask about this, was really fantastic. But the spice just wasn’t there on their hottest wings. They advertise over and over, in your face, how dangerous the heat of their wings is. And it’s just not at the level you want it to be if you’re looking for real heat. Staff was nice, and I’d return if I was nearby and craving wings. Although, I’d definitely want to check out more spots nearby first.

Legendary, amazing, always delicious!!! My wife who grew up in East NY cannot believe how awesome the wings are here, anytime we're in the area we make sure to stop at least one time! The service is always super fast and everyone is always friendly!!! We can't wait till we're out this way again to come back!! Or.   You could just open a location out here in the Albany area!!!

This place is amazing and the clerks are incredibly helpful and right on the spot with my order. Is very accessible for people with disabilities and they are willing to help bring your orders the table when you're not capable of carry it yourself. It's a fun by vibrant place!

Great coffee shop, right across from a Starbucks, but doing great business. We had spinach-feta omelots that we're improbably delicious, and the coffee was excellent as well. A great place for a cozy breakfast for two for $20.

This place has great coffee and breakfast food items.  The breakfast wrap with sausage or ham is my favorite.  The caramel macchiato is amazing.  They have improved on yelling out names audibly for food orders.   As long as they keep hiring people who can yell names, they will be solid for years to come.

Nice place, very good coffee, but I feel like it's gone down hill the last couple of years.  Doesn't feel like it's a local place anymore. It has become commercially uncomfortable, too many hard wood furniture pieces. Starbuck across the street feels more like a small local coffee shop than this does. I used to love to bring people here from out of town, or meet up with friends to enjoy lunch or a coffee, and sit in comfortable chairs.
Excellent gluten free options! They are mindful of cross contamination. Love the Spot's Chicken Pesto Sandwich on a gluten free roll with salad! Yum!
